article.title: Modelling Coupled Oscillations of Volcanic CO2 Emissions and Glacial Cycles

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the grey shading in panel (a) of Figure 1 represent?
choices: Increasing CO2 concentration in the atmosphere
Decreasing CO2 concentration in the atmosphere

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the grey shading in panel (b) of Figure 1 represent?
According to Figure 1, what is the effect of a 30-50 kyr MOR CO2 emissions lag on a 40 kyr sea level cycle?
choices: It reinforces the sea level cycle, making changes more extreme.
It has no significant effect on the sea level cycle.
It opposes the sea level cycle, counteracting changes.
It creates a 100 kyr sea level cycle.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary assumption behind the MOR CO2 emissions shown in panel (b) of Figure 1?
choices: Sea level is the primary driver of MOR CO2 emissions.
Insolation is the primary driver of MOR CO2 emissions.
Subaerial volcanic eruptions are the primary driver of MOR CO2 emissions.
Atmospheric temperature is the primary driver of MOR CO2 emissions.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following is NOT directly affected by the extent of the ice sheet in the model?
Which of the following is the ONLY factor that directly affects the ice sheet in the model?
How does the carbon concentration in the atmosphere influence the energy balance model?
choices: Through changes in ice sheet extent.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary external driving force for the model system?
What is the approximate lag time shown for the subaerial volcanic CO2 emissions response to sea level change in panel (b)?
What determines the magnitude and lag time of the MOR Green's function in panel (c)?
choices: The depth of the magma chamber.
The rate of sea level change.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key difference between the MOR CO2 emissions curves shown in panel (c) for different lag times?
choices: The total change in CO2 emissions.
The peak change in CO2 emissions.
The timing of the peak change in CO2 emissions.
The duration of the CO2 emissions change.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is assumed about the relationship between SAV eruption volume per unit time and CO2 emissions in the model?
